com.bandyer.communication_center.call_client

Class CallClient

  • com.bandyer.communication_center.call_client.CallClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OnCallCreationObserver, OnCallEventObserver

    public class CallClient
implements OnCallCreationObserver, OnCallEventObserver

    It's the main item required to connect to the Bandyer platform.

    Once initialized, the object will connect and keep the connection with Bandyer platform, communicating and exchanging events with the servers.

    After a connection is established, the server will authenticate the client.

    Once the authentication is successful, it will be possible to make and receive calls to and from other users.

    This item has the following capabilities:

    • It places calls with other users within the same company. Bandyer platform will contact the designated users, notifying them if they are offline. If the call can be placed, the call process will be handled by the Call object.

    • It receives incoming calls from other users within the same company.

    • It allows to join a call through an URL received from outside the app.

    • It allows to join a call through a remote notification.

      • call

        public void call(java.util.List<java.lang.String> users,
                 CallOptions callOptions,
                 OnCallCreationObserver onCallCreationObserver)

        Creates a call with the users and the options provided as arguments. This is an asynchronous process and success or failure will be reported in the observer provided as argument.

        Parameters:
        users - List of users to call, identified by the userAlias
        callOptions - Optional call options
        onCallCreationObserver - The observer to be notified when the call has been created or if it has failed

      • join

        public void join(java.lang.String url,
                 OnCallCreationObserver onCallCreationObserver)

        Creates and joins a call with the provided url. This is an asynchronous process and success or failure will be reported in the observer provided as argument.

        Parameters:
        url - Url of the call to join
        onCallCreationObserver - The observer to be notified when the call has been created

      • handleNotification

        public void handleNotification(java.lang.String data,
                               OnNotificationObserver onNotificationObserver)

        Parses the notification payload provided as first argument. If the payload is in the expected format it will report a new call object, otherwise, if the payload cannot be parsed, or is malformed an error will be reported via the observer.

        An error will be reported also in the case the call client is not connected, or another call is in progress. You should not pass the notification payload received from APNs as is. You must provide the string containing the data your back-end has received from the bandyer's back-end system.

        Note: The call client must be connected to bandyer's platform before it can handle a remote notification. You must call this method after onCallClientInitialized(sessionUser) was called, otherwise it will fail even if the payload is valid.

        Parameters:
        data - Bandyer's notification payload
        onNotificationObserver - OnNotificationObserver result listener
